meanings.definition: The highest point or peak of something.
meanings.sent1: Reaching the pinnacle of the mountain was a great accomplishment.
meanings.sent2: Standing at the pinnacle of success, she felt proud of her hard work.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel thought the top of the tree was the pinnacle spot for a nap.
meanings.sent4: The sun setting behind the mountains created a beautiful pinnacle of colors.
meanings.sent5: The pinnacle of the roller coaster offered a thrilling view of the park.

meanings.definition: A high point of achievement or development.
meanings.sent1: Graduating from college was the pinnacle of her academic journey.
meanings.sent2: Winning the championship was the pinnacle of their sports season.
meanings.sent3: Eating ice cream for breakfast was the pinnacle of her rebellious behavior.
meanings.sent4: The new invention marked the pinnacle of technological advancement.
meanings.sent5: The concert was the pinnacle of entertainment for the town.

meanings.definition: A small turret or spire on a building.
meanings.sent1: The castle had a beautiful pinnacle on top of its tower.
meanings.sent2: The church's pinnacle gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The pigeon perched on the pinnacle of the clock tower, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: The pinnacle of the cathedral was adorned with intricate carvings.
meanings.sent5: The pinnacle of the lighthouse guided ships safely to shore.
